intro: Sagmen scabiosa, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow or white flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white down. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in meadows. Sagmen scabiosa is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
